title: CSC 466: Knowledge Discovery from Data
description: Learned about KDD methods and technologies such as Bayes Classifier, Decision Trees, Clustering, Recommender Systems, Collaborative Filtering, etc.
Labs included implementation of KDD techniques with Python. Made a React Webapp to help users learn about Decision Trees by implementing the algorithm from scratch.

title: CSC 480: Artificial Intelligence
description: Learned about AI techniques including The Agent Model, Informed Search Methods, Local Search Methods, Genetic Algorithms, Constraint Propagation, Monte Carlo Tree Search
Projects included developing "smart" programs to solve puzzle like challenges

title: CPE 464: Introduction to Networks
description: Learned about computer network architecture, and standard networking protcols for communication (TCP, IP, Ethernet, HTTPS)

Labs included finishing written exercises on different network protocols and services. Projects included parsing network packets, implementing a chat-server client, and designing + implementing file transfer over UDP with a sliding window algorithm for flow control.

title: CPE 321: Introduction to Computer Security
description: Learned about software security fundamentals, modern and historic cryptography, social engineering, etc.
Labs included completing Capture The Flag exercises, and assignments consisted of implementing interesting security related algorithms

title: CSC 369: Introduction to Distributed Computing
description: Learned about distributed computing paradigms and how to gain insights (output) from data (input) in a distrubuted fashion
Assignments included processing data in a distributed manner with Hadoop (Java) and Spark (Scala) to answer specific questions related to the data

title: CPE 453: Introduction to Operating Systems
description: Learned about system calls, virtual memory management, file systems, interprocess comunications, etc.

Assignments consisted of implementing a memory management library (malloc, realloc, free), managing lightweight processes, synchronizing interprocess communication, and traversing the MINIX file system

title: CSC 437: Dynamic Web Development
description: Learned about advanced JS concepts, server side development with Express and Postman (for testing), and client side development with React and Redux
Projects included a step by step implementation of a full stack chat application starting with writing tests in Postman, then developing a robust server, and finally developing the client side webapp

title: STAT 331: Statistical Computing with R
description: Learned how to work with data including visualizing it, cleaning and managing it, and performing statistical analysis on it. Also learned how to use R for statisical computing including simulations, hypothesis test, Monte Carlo experiments, etc.
No project; homework and activities included completing exercises with R

title: CSC 430: Programming Languages
description: Learned about functional programming design through implementation of an interpreted language including features such as expressions, functions, environments, closures, mutation, objects, type systems, and syntactic abstraction. Also learned about different garbage collection techniques.
Labs and projects included developing an interpreter and parser for a functional programming language with customly defined syntax

title: CSC 445: Theory of Computation
description: Learned about the different classes of computation languages and automata including DFA, NFA for Regular languages, CFG, PDA for Context Free Languages, and Turing Machines

No projects; understood theory by proving closure properties for different classes of languages and determining through proofs or examples precisely what class of languages a given language belongs to

title: CSC 365: Introduction to Database Systems
description: Learned about database models with an emphasis on Entity-Relationship and Relational models, data definition and manipulation languages, the Structured Query Language (SQL), database design, and application development tools
Labs included completing query building exercises and developing a small application in JDBC

title: CPE 315: Computer Architecture
description: Learned about underlying architecture of a modern computer including datapaths, pipelines, caches, etc.
Labs included pseudo-implementation of different components of computer architecture in Java

title: CSC 349: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
description: Learned how to solve different types of algorithms such as Greedy, Dynamic Programming, Divide and Conquer, etc. by designing algorithms to solve problems and by assessing their complexity
Assignments included solving problems that utilize different types of algorithms

title: DATA 301: Introduction to Data Science
description: Learned how to work with DataFrames using Pandas, how to collect data in JSON/XML/HTML format and store it in a DataFrame, and how to build, optimize, and assess machine learning models (classification and regression)
Project included development of a machine learning model from scratch to address an interesting research question

title: CSC 307: Introduction to Software Engineering
description: Learned about software
development lifecycle methodologies, architecture and design patterns, advanced version control with git, and software testing
Project required application of theoretical software development principle towards building a full stack application

title: CPE 202: Data Structure and Algorithms
description: Learned about fundamental data structures such as queue, stacks, hash tables, heaps, and graphs and different sorting algorithms
Projects included implementation and application of mentioned data structures in Python

title: CPE 203: Object Oriented Programming and Design
description: Learned about advanced object oriented principles and their (abstract) implementation in Java such as the single responsibility principle and Liskov substitution principle

Projects included implementation of hash tables in Java and refactoring a large code base written as a functional program to be object oreinted with the objective to put theoretical principles into practice

title: CPE 225: Introduction to Computer Organization
description: Learned about the different components that make up a simple computer and how they interact with each other, as well as the basics of the C languages
Projects included developing basic assembly scripts and implementation of grep with C

title: CSC 348: Discrete Structures
description: Learned about structures of computer science such as sets, relations, functions, graphs and trees and how to more accurately deduce the complexity of algorithms, especially recursive ones
No projects; applied knowledge by using different proof techniques to prove algorithms, etc.

title: CPE 357: Systems Programming
description: Learned advanced concepts about the C language, unix commands, and shell scripting
Projects included implementation and application of hash tables in C, and implementation of LZW compression with the trie data structure
